title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: N. C. Brackett to R. M. Manly, December 17, 1866
summary: Brackett reports on the schools in his district, which encompasses the Shenandoah Valley. According to Brackett, Staunton has the most black students in the Valley, and Waynesboro still needs a place to hold classes.
keywords: education, Aid/Relief, Church/Religious Activity, Race Relations, American Civil War
